Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a detailed land habitat, such as a playground or garden, and depict a variety of plants and animals that typically inhabit it.
The student can draw a water habitat, like a pond or stream, with accuracy, including various water plants and animals common to such an environment.
The student can effectively compare and contrast the types of plants in a land habitat with those in a water habitat through detailed illustrations.
The student can accurately compare the types of animals in a land habitat to those in a water habitat, clearly showing their differences and similarities in the drawings.
The student can observe and depict patterns across the habitats, such as commonalities in plant and animal species that can exist in multiple habitats.
The student can comprehensively label and record the names of plants and animals in each drawn habitat.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally miss labeling one or two organisms, but this oversight is rare and does not indicate a misunderstanding.
The student might draw certain organisms slightly stylized or simplified, but this does not affect the accuracy of the habitat representation.
